5. The use of the following definitions of the latent and 
active first stages of labour is recommended for practice:
"" The latent, first stage is a period of time characterized 
by painful uterine contractions and variable changes of 
the cervix, including some degree of effacement and 
slower progression of dilatation up to 5Â cm for first and 
subsequent labours.
